title: Musk vs. Musk: the billionaire's obsession with Twitter is undermining his accomplishments
description: Tesla's image has suffered from multiple controversies triggered by Elon Musk after he purchased the social network. Its stock has lost 60% since the beginning of the year, and investors are calling for a refocus on the car manufacturer.

title: 'It's like a religion': Out in droves in Doha, Argentina fans are some of football's most committed supporters
description: About 50,000 South American fans are expected to attend the World Cup final at the Lusail Stadium on Sunday to watch Argentina face France.

title: Three chefs' recipes for Christmas
description: Christmas can be a time to show off your culinary skills, but you may have to up the ante depending on who's sat around the table. These recipes are for those guests with more 'refined' taste buds.

title: As Covid-19 explodes, China now is voluntarily locking down
description: Since even before the abandonment of China's restrictive zero-Covid policy at the beginning of December, infections soared across the country.

title: 'Women are made invisible to legitimize a repressive immigration policy'
description: In an interview with 'Le Monde', sociologist Elsa Tyszler points out the lack of discourse on female migrants and the violence they are victims of.

title: World Cup 2022: Croatia beats Morocco 2-1 to take third place
description: Before Sunday's final between France and Argentina, Croatia defeated Morocco on Saturday in the third-place playoff of the World Cup.

title: Nigerian singer Asake 'devastated' after woman in London gig crush dies
description: 33-year-old Rebecca Ikumelo died in a London hospital on Saturday. Some 4,000 people were at the popular music venue on Friday night.

title: At the Comédie-Française, an interpretation of 'The Snow Queen' let's go of Disney's 'Frozen'
description: In their adaptation of Hans Christian Andersen's fairytale, Johanna Boyé and Elisabeth Ventura have restored all the ambivalence and mystery of the original text, resulting in a very different story to that of the American blockbuster.

title: 'Something to Talk About' songwriter Shirley Eikhard dies at 67
description: The 1991 song won Bonnie Raitt a Grammy.

title: 'Qatargate': Attention shifts to Morocco in EU Parliament corruption scandal
description: Close connections between former MEP Antonio Panzeri, who is in jail, and Abderrahim Atmoun, Morocco's ambassador to Warsaw have come to light.

title: Here's how the climate and biodiversity crises are linked
description: An increasing number of scientists are calling for the two issues to be addressed together, with global warming exacerbating the destruction of ecosystems and vice versa.

title: Part of haul from 2019 German museum heist recovered
description: A possible agreement between prosecutors and the men accused of the theft might have enabled the partial recovery of the 18th-century treasures stolen in 2019.

title: Ukraine races to restore power after Friday's major Russian attack
description: Russia on Friday launched one of its biggest attacks since the war started, firing dozens of missiles across the country.

title: Amid freezing temperatures, French minister urges offices with space to help the homeless
description: Temperatures have fallen several degrees below zero over the past few days across much of France.

title: The United Kingdom is at a a stalemate
description: A wave of large-scale strikes is hitting the UK as workers across the public sector, who have strong public support, demand wage increases in the face of surging inflation.

title: World Cup 2022: Deschamps not worried about lack of support in Doha for the final
description: As Lionel Messi bids to win his first World Cup, Argentina will have far more supporters than France in the crowd for Sunday's final.

title: Grief and anger abound in Vaulx-en-Velin after fire kills 10 in French suburb near Lyon
description: Traumatized, the residents across the northeastern Lyon neighborhood are mobilizing to help the bereaved and displaced families. Residents of the building say the apartment block had been falling apart for years.

title: Tunisia election: Powerful UGTT union is distancing itself from the government
description: As Tunisia is electing a new Assembly on Saturday, the only organization that is likely to thwart President Kais Saied's plans is speaking up against him.

title: Parisian chefs are moving across the Seine river, betting on a left-bank comeback
description: Twenty years of trendy chefs and natural wines are starting to oversaturate Paris' right bank, with the more traditional left bank starting to make a slow comeback.

title: 2022 World Cup: The history of the third-place playoffs show their importance
description: The fight for third place, which will take place on Sunday between Morocco and Croatia, can be a time to lay the foundations for a team's future success.

title: France hopes to stop spread of virus on eve of World Cup final
description: France players Raphael Varane, Ibrahima Konate and Kingsley Coman sat out training on Friday with cold-like symptoms two days before the World Cup final against Argentina.

title: War in Ukraine: Georgia's ambiguous neutrality
description: Seeing as Russia has been occupying 20% of its territory since 2008, the Georgian population has shown unfailing solidarity with Ukraine. But the government is doing everything it can to avoid irritating Moscow.

title: Musk says will restore suspended Twitter accounts of journalists
description: Some American journalists who had reported on the suspension of a Twitter account that is tracking Elon Musk's private plane got their accounts suspended in turn on Thursday.

title: World Cup 2022: Qatari women join in on the fun
description: After initial reservations and caution, Qatari women supporters have developed a taste for the World Cup by 'living the experience to the fullest.' Caught up in the fever of the Moroccan team's journey, they have been seen both in the stadiums and in the streets.

title: 2022 World Cup: Antoine Griezmann, the driving force behind Les Bleus
description: The French player has become indispensable to the French team since the beginning of the World Cup in Qatar. On Sunday, he will try to lead Les Bleus to a new victory in the final against Argentina.

title: New York to institutionalize the mentally ill, voluntarily or not
description: Since the start of the year, the subway has already been the scene of nine homicides, most often committed by unbalanced people. Accused of complacency, Democratic mayor Eric Adams has decided to play hardball.

title: Tunisia: Legislative elections with no debate or passion
description: The campaigns for Saturday's election, in which 1,058 candidates are competing, have generated little excitement among a population more concerned about the cost of living.

title: How an intruder got past Elysée Palace security, without anyone telling Macron
description: Several reports addressed to French President Emmanuel Macron and seen by 'Le Monde' underline recurrent security problems around the president's official residence.

title: World Cup 2022: 'The French team plays with a serenity that others do not have,' says Youri Djorkaeff
description: The former French player and 1998 world champion said the leaders of 'Les Bleus' are much more visible than in 2018. He is pleased with the surprises and twists delivered by the World Cup in Qatar.

title: US justice chief orders equal treatment for cocaine, crack offenders
description: 'The crack/powder disparity is simply not supported by science, as there are no significant pharmacological differences between the drugs,' said Merrick Garland's directive.

title: Scientists have discovered why methane rose dramatically in the atmosphere in 2020
description: Large increases in this very potent greenhouse gas are linked to decreasing air pollution and increasing emissions from wetlands, two causes that may further exacerbate climate disruption.

title: Jan. 6 panel eyes recommending 3 criminal charges against Trump
description: Besides insurrection, the panel is also considering recommending prosecutors pursue charges for obstructing an official proceeding and conspiracy to defraud the US.

title: How an Israeli TV show has managed to portray modern-day Iran
description: Former Israeli investigative journalist Moshe Zonder has co-created 'Tehran,' a suspense series that dives into contemporary Iran. Unable to film there, he tapped multiple sources to draw as faithful a portrait as possible of the reality of the country.
